executive_summary: Editors in the United States have traditionally provided essential services, but the rise of the internet has caused their importance to diminish. Online tools such as Google Docs, Ginger, Grammarly and Microsoft Word Spellcheck have encouraged businesses, individuals and other customers to forego using traditional editing services, hindering revenue. Poor economic conditions during COVID-19 discouraged the in-house production of editorial services, reducing external competition. Alternatively, sluggish growth inhibited demand for printing. These factors caused revenue to creep upward in 2020. As restrictions were relaxed during the pandemic recovery, consumer spending surged, causing corporate profit to rise. Companies used these increased funds to hire their own editors, causing revenue to plunge in 2021 and 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The increased prevalence of in-house departments and online editing tools
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The increased prevalence of in-house departments and online editing tools has also caused profit to drop recently. Overall, revenue for editors in the United States is expected to drop at a CAGR of 3.8% during the current period, reaching $2.6 billion in 2024. This includes a 5.2% decline in that year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: GREATER INTERNET USAGE HAS INHIBITED DEMAND FOR TRADITIONAL EDITING SERVICES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Before the advent of the Internet, businesses, households, government agencies and other organizations didn't have access to tools that helped them with spelling, grammar, sentence structure, flow and other elements of writing, so they turned to editors to ensure their documents were written correctly and structurally sound. The internet has led to the rise of automatic editing tools such as Microsoft Word Spellcheck, which helps users ensure their documents have the correct spelling and grammar. Other tools such as Grammarly, Ginger and Google Docs help writers improve the tone, sentence structure and flow of a document. These tools have replaced editors' core functions, contributing to declining revenue during the current period as internet usage has grown.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: REVENUE HELD FAIRLY STEADY DURING COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: States and localities enforced the closure of some businesses and social distancing rules during the pandemic. Since consumers couldn't go to many of their favorite stores, corporate profit dropped. Lower corporate profit inhibited the creation of in-house editing teams and the use of artificial intelligence (AI)-assisted writing tools since they didn't have the funds to absorb the start-up costs, reducing external competition and aiding revenue growth. Alternatively, slow business activity reduced spending on printing, inhibiting downstream demand for the industry. Overall, revenue for editing companies crept upward in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: SOARING CORPORATE PROFIT DURING THE RECOVERY MADE SUBSTITUTES MORE ATTRACTIVE
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers flocked to retailers, restaurants and other businesses amid the relaxation of pandemic restrictions, causing corporate profit to soar. Rising business income gave businesses the funds to hire more editors in-house, siphoning revenue away from the industry. Corporations also used excess funds to invest in more computers and software. More businesses implemented editing tools such as Grammarly as a result, hindering the industry's performance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STEADY ECONOMIC GROWTH WILL REDUCE REVENUE FROM BUSINESSES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite current concerns related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, GDP is expected to rise steadily during the outlook period. Since higher economic growth will spur business activity, corporate profit will increase. Companies will use their newfound funds by creating more in-house editorial departments, raising external competition and hindering revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Higher GDP will boost tax revenue, increasing funding for many government agencies
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Higher GDP will boost tax revenue, increasing funding for many government agencies. Since these agencies will have more cash, they'll use this money to hire their own editors, causing spending from the public sector to decline.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: I N C R E A S E D  T E C H N O L O G I C A L  P R O G R E S S  W I L L  R A I S E  I N T E R N E T  P E N E T R A T I O N
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As productivity growth increases, the Internet will become more essential in business, leisure and communication. Since more businesses, government agencies, individuals and other organizations will be online, exposure to editing tools such as Microsoft Spellcheck, Grammarly, Ginger and Evernote will increase, boosting their usage and taking business away from traditional editors. Artificial intelligence (AI) will be applied to these applications to help customers tailor their writing to the field they're working in, making human editors less useful.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry offer many types of editorial services to ensure their customers' documents sound functionally and grammatically correct. These include proofreading, document editing and fact-checking services. Editing companies sell their services to hospitals, households, government agencies and other businesses.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

threats: Private investment in computers and software

key_trends: Soaring corporate profit during the pandemic recovery has contributed to falling revenue during the current period. Slow economic growth during COVID-19 caused the industry to expand slightly in 2020.
High economic growth during the outlook period will cause more businesses to hire editors in-house, hindering revenue. Increased technological progress will boost the uptake of online editing tools.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Businesses such as financial institutions, retailers, newspapers, wholesalers, manufacturers, colleges and other companies hire editors to tweak journal articles, letters to employees, financial statements, emails, research papers and other documents. Since the commercial sector encompasses many different businesses, they comprise more than half of revenue. Falling corporate profit during COVID-19 made it harder for companies to afford editorial services, causing businesses' revenue share to creep downward during the current period.

Most Americans have health insurance, so hospitals, clinics and other medical institutions must communicate with insurance companies to provide necessary care at the correct cost. Insurance-related documents must convey the right information to ensure patients and insurance companies are well-informed, so the healthcare industry pays editors to review these materials. Hospitals and clinics may also use editorial services to tweak medical reports, patient records and charts and documents outlining healthcare policies and procedures. Since spending on healthcare has soared since the pandemic, this segment's revenue share has surged during the current period.

Public agencies that use editors include the Department of Defense (DOD), the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA). Since many of these agencies write regulations, they pay professional editors to proofread and review them. Government organizations are expansive bureaucracies, so they also use editors to review documents relating to forms and applications, contracts and agreements, budgets and financial statements, public notices and press releases. Concerns relating to large budget deficits have caused legislatures to reduce investment in various agencies, causing the public sector's revenue share to fall during the current period.

Households and individuals make up a small share of the market. These customers mostly include independent journalists paying out-of-pocket to publish their articles and aspiring novelists seeking to get their new books on the market. As incomes rise, individuals can afford the industry's services more easily, boosting revenue from this market segment. Per capita disposable income jumped in 2020 because of pandemic-era aid but has fallen recently as subsidies have run out. Overall, incomes haven't changed much during the current period, causing individuals' revenue share to hold steady over the same time period.

products_and_services.product_description: Document editing is the comprehensive examination and review of journal articles, books and other materials that are subject to edit. Forms of editing include content revision, structural modifications, changes in formatting and styling, inserting or removing elements and other services.

Editing companies offer a slew of other services that comprise nearly one-quarter of revenue. Developmental editing involves the tweaking of big-picture elements such as plot structure, augmentation and character development to make sure a story or article is coherent and appealing to its readers. The industry also offers editing services for writers of specific genres, such as academic, technical and fiction editing. These services are essential because many journalists and writers seek experts in their field to understand their content the best.

Proofreading is the process of carefully examining documents to find and correct errors related to spelling, grammar, punctuation, syntax and formatting. Proofreading is similar to content revision, but it's more focused on ensuring grammatical accuracy instead of clarity. Demand for proofreading has held up well amid rising internet penetration, as individuals, businesses and government organizations preparing formal documents want people to review their writing. Proofreading's revenue share has increased during the current period as a result.

Many editorial service providers offer fact-checking services to their customers to ensure a document's information is true. Providing fact-checking services enables the industry to diversify its service offerings, giving it access to new revenue streams. As the increased use of social media and fake news websites have increased the need for fact-checking, this segment's revenue share has surged during the current period.

tier_2_suppliers: Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand from printing represents spending on print on paper, textile products, metal, glass, plastic and other materials. When demand from printing increases, spending on editorial services often rises because traditional editors often proofread and make changes to physical documents. Growth in demand from printing represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

Advances in communications technology can have varying effects on demand for editorial services. Although technology can lower the cost of providing services, an increase in the percentage of services conducted online also helps businesses to do more work in-house and use overseas services via the internet, hurting demand for the industry's services.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Price of Computers and Peripheral Equipment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Falling prices for faster and more accessible computers have enabled consumers to purchase a personal computer and the necessary software to learn editorial skills. Conversely, declining computer prices also lower initial capital costs for editorial services, though the net effect of falling prices is negative for this industry because of their effects on technological progress.

Rising corporate profit enables businesses to better afford to outsource editorial services to the industry. Alternatively, a rise in this driver may also assist businesses in hiring employees to perform editing functions in-house, lowering demand for editorial services. Overall, the net effect of rising corporate profit is a drop in demand for editorial services.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Private Investment in Computers and Software
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Private investment in computers and software measures the total annual expenditure by businesses on computer technology. As private investment in computers and related equipment rises, companies prefer to hire experienced employees with computing and word processing software, which leads to a higher level of in-house editorial services. Growth in private investment in computers and software poses a potential threat to this industry.

business_locations.location_description: The graph shows the percentage distribution of editing establishments compared to the population across different regions of the US. The Southeast region has the highest percentage of establishments at 23.4%, while the Rocky Mountains region has the lowest at 5.6%. The distribution of establishments does not exactly match the population distribution, indicating factors other than population influencing the concentration of editing businesses in certain regions.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Barriers to entry are low because of minimal start-up costs and licenses.
Many companies seek editors who have college degrees, but no specific certifications are necessary to work in this industry.

basis_points.basis_description: The importance of localization for editors keeps market share concentration low.
Small editing companies that have a high reputation in their community retain customers, making it difficult for large players to take over the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_description: High fragmentation in this industry gives businesses, individuals and other buyers many editing companies to choose from.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: INFLATION CAUSES EMPLOYEES TO DEMAND HIGHER PAY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry is very labor-intensive, so wages comprise nearly half of revenue. Inflation has put upward pressure on prices, making workers more strapped. Editors have sought higher salaries from their employers to deal with rising costs. Employees have threatened to switch jobs if their bosses don't give them better salaries. Employers have relented as a result, causing wages' revenue share to grow during the current period.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is adding new patent technologies at a rate in line with the average across all industries, which suggests a stable addition of technology. However, the concentration of technologies is high. This creates the potential for innovation outside the focus of industry leaders to gain traction.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The increased prevalence of online editing tools and in-house editors has raised external competition in this industry, causing revenue to decline precipitously. Since the siphoning of business away from editing companies has grown relatively steadily, revenue volatility has been low.

Revenue is influenced by corporate profit, computer prices and demand from printing. Since these drivers have fluctuated amid changing economic conditions, they've contributed to some level of volatility for editors.

FAQs.question: What is the document about?
FAQs.answer: The document contains industry data such as revenue, employment, exports, and other financial metrics for a particular industry over the years 2005 to 2016.

FAQs.question: What kind of data is presented in the table?
FAQs.answer: The table presents annual data on revenue, industry value added, number of establishments and enterprises, employment, exports, imports, wages, and domestic demand for the industry from 2005 to 2016.

FAQs.question: Are there any missing values in the data?
FAQs.answer: Yes, the values for imports, wages, and domestic demand are missing for all years in the data table.
